quotes.quote: You have to set goals that are almost out of reach. If you set a goal that is attainable without much work or thought, you are stuck with something below your true talent and potential.
The major value of reaching goals is not to acquire it, but it's the person you become while you're working to acquire it.
If you want to reach a goal, you must see the reaching in your own mind before you actually arrive at your goal.
You measure the size of the accomplishment by the obstacles you have to overcome to reach your goals.
All who have accomplished great things have had a great aim, have fixed their gaze on a goal which was high, one which sometimes seemed impossible.

You better keep your lane on this race of reaching out for our dreams and goals; don't stand in the middle of the road because you will be run over by those who are determined to reach the finishing line.
All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them.
Take the challenge of your life. Reach out to your goals. There is no limit to what you can achieve.
Believing you can achieve a goal is vital to reaching a goal.
Keep your face always toward the sunshine and shadows will fall behind you.
Reach high, for stars lie hidden in you. Dream deep, for every dream precedes the goal.
It's important to set your own goals and work hard to achieve them.
A goal is not always meant to be reached, it often serves simply as something to aim at.
Whether or not you reach your goals in life depends entirely on how well you prepare for them and how badly you want them.
Goals. There's no telling what you can do when you get inspired by them. There's no telling what you can do when you believe in them. And there's no telling what will happen when you act upon them.
To reach your own goals and dreams, you must learn how to assist others in reaching theirs.
A dream becomes a goal when action is taken toward its achievement.
Goals give you a compass in order to direct your path through life. Goals focus your thoughts and actions on areas that have precise purpose and meaning.
One part at a time, one day at a time, we can accomplish any goal we set for ourselves.
You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
The real value of setting and achieving goals lies not in the rewards you receive, but in the person you become as a result of reaching your goals.

The thing about goals is that living without them is a lot more fun, in the short run. It seems to me, though, that the people who get things done, who lead, who grow and who make an impact those people have goals.
If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy and inspires your hopes.
The best way to approach a goal is to first break it down into very small bite size steps. Each one of these steps should lead logically to the next step to be completed in a linear order.
Whoever wants to reach a distant goal must take small steps.
If you set goals and go after them with all the determination you can muster, your gifts will take you places that will amaze you.

Stop waiting for others to tell you what you can do. Start putting faith into your own strengths and talents. Instead of questioning whether you can reach your goals, move forward with conviction and confidence.
To reach your goal authentically is probably, in the end, going to mean much more to you than having reached it in a false way.
People with goals succeed because they know where they're going.
If you work so hard to reach your goal but you lose your pole in the very last run, that's hard to take.
